info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 4 at 6:50AM CDT until June 4 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Blanco, Gillespie and Kendall.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 650 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blanco, Stonewall, Albert, Hye, Rocky Creek, Flugrath, LBJ State Park and LBJ National Historical Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Blanco, TX; Gillespie, TX; Kendall, TX
